test.question: Ten years ago, Sophia was half of Emma's age. If the ratio of their present ages is 3:4, what will be the total of their present ages?
The product of the ages of Olivia and Emily is 240. If twice the age of Emily is more than Olivia's age by 4 years, what is Emily's age?
The ages of two persons differ by 16 years. 6 years ago, the elder one was 3 times as old as the younger one. What is the present age of the elder person?
Present ages of Madison, Elizabeth, and Abigail are in proportions 4:7:9. Eight years ago, the sum of their ages was 56. What are their present ages (in years)?
The sum of the present ages of a son and his father is 60 years. Six years ago, the father's age was five times the age of the son. After 6 years, what will be the son's age?
The sum of ages of 5 children born at intervals of 3 years each is 50 years. Find out the age of the youngest child?
Mother is aged three times more than her son William. After 8 years, she would be two and a half times of William's age. After another 8 years, how many times would she be of William's age?
Liam is two years older than Noah who is twice as old as James. The total of the ages of Liam, Noah and James is 27 . How old is Noah?
Lucas is younger than Elijah by 7 years and their ages are in the respective ratio of 7:9. How old is Lucas?
Emma's present age is two-fifth of the age of her mother. After 8 years, Emma will be one-half of the age of her mother. What is the present age of the mother?
